BACKGROUND : In previous study ( 1 ) show continuous perisciatic infusion 2 mg/ml ropivacaine 5 ml/h 55 hour provide well analgesia placebo ambulatory foot surgery . Similar result report Singelyn ( 2 ) , Ilfeld ( 3 ) White ( 4 ) . But , different pump different basal infusion rate use study . Singelyn use infusion rate 7 ml/h 48 hour , Ilfeld use mechanical pump adjustable infusion rate , start 8 ml/h patient control analgesia ( PCA ) 2 ml/20 minute 2 postoperative day . In White 's study elastomeric pump reservoir 500 ml infusion rate 5 ml/h use 55 hour . Capdevila ( 5 ) show patient prefer elastomeric pump cause few problem . That choice well . The analgesic efficacy study good patient treatment group less pain few sleep disturbance placebo group . The question whether high infusion rate long duration would even well effect . The aim study compare ( double blind manner ) two different regimen continuous perisciatic nerve infusion ropivacaine 2 mg/ml ambulatory foot surgery : 1. elastomeric pump reservoir 275 ml , infusion rate 5 ml/h ( duration 55 hour ) 2. elastomeric pump reservoir 500 ml , infusion rate 8 ml/h ( duration 62 hour ) . Design : A randomized , double blind study 40 ambulatory patient undergo foot ankle surgery . These patient randomize receive either regimen 1 . ( 5 ml/h 55 hour ) regimen 2 . ( 8 ml/h 62 hour ) . The randomization procedure : sequentially number , seal , opaque envelope contain computer produce random number treatment allocation . Blinding procedure : pre-numbered identical container mark `` Test drug '' , date production infusion start/end provide registered nurse ( SK ) . The patient acute pain nurse ( EB ) , evaluate effect two treatment , blind . On 3 postoperative day patient contact phone acute pain nurse standard questionnaire complete . The primary effect variable worst pain first postoperative day evaluate VAS score .
